meta.name: Highlight Mobility Design System
meta.mission: Create a calm, confident mobility companion that feels premium yet friendly across every surface.

brand_principles.description: Every screen should answer 'what's next?' with obvious actions, strong contrast, and clear hierarchy.
Pair pragmatic layouts with soft corners, rounded typography, and approachable illustrations so logistics feel personal.
Use disciplined spacing, minimal color, and precise grid alignment to communicate trust and reliability.
Transitions should be subtle and physics-informed, guiding attention without stealing focus.

layout.grid: Mobile portrait safe area width 375pt (iPhone 14 baseline). 12-column flexible grid with 4pt gutters. Primary content spans full width on utility screens and 10 columns on marketing surfaces.
layout.safe_zones: Respect status bar and navigation indicator with 12pt padding. Floating panels keep 12pt inset from edges.
layout.scroll_behaviors: Map + list screens use a fixed map layer with scrollable sheets or lists above, implemented with slivers where possible.

spacing.application: Stacks breathe with 12-16pt vertical rhythm. Interactive elements keep a minimum of 48pt touch height. Cards retain 16pt internal padding.

typography.primary_family: Uber Move / Rounded geometric sans. Fallback: SF Pro Rounded, Inter

display_l.usage: Large promotional headlines, e.g., banner offers.

ember_orange.usage: Supporting CTAs, gradients, and service highlights.

pulse_magenta.usage: Information accents, status pills, and premium tiers.

pure_white.usage: Typography on dark fills and light surfacing.

whatsapp_green.usage: Dedicated color for WhatsApp support entry point.

colors.usage_notes: Color is mostly neutral. Reserve accent.primary (#F7052D) for hero CTAs, accent.secondary (#FD6201) for secondary actions, accent.info (#D41983) for data highlights, and accent.whatsapp (#00FF7F) exclusively for WhatsApp support buttons. Pure white (#FFFFFF) grounds typography on colored fills.

light.description: Uses base neutrals, accent, status and map colors defined above.

iconography.style: Outlined pictograms with rounded corners and minimal detail.
iconography.fill_usage: Solid fills for vehicles and hero illustrations; system icons remain outlined.
iconography.color_usage: Default to ink-muted; switch to accent_primary on active state.

imagery.illustrations: Isometric, slightly whimsical objects with soft gradients and drop shadows.
imagery.photography: If used, keep muted saturation with warm undertones to align with promo banners.
imagery.map_overlay: Use semi-transparent rounded rectangles and simple icon badges for live callouts.

motion.principles: Material-like easing (0.2/0/0/1). Panels slide vertically, map markers spring lightly (damping 0.7).
motion.behavior: Buttons fade between states; list items push content with shared-axis transitions.

rules.compact: Use single-column lists and full-width bottom sheets.
rules.medium: Use 2-3 column grids where applicable; bottom sheets max 640pt width and centered on large screens.
rules.expanded: Use master-detail with navigation or lists on the left and map + detail content on the right.

no_rides.message: No rides available right now. Try a different time or location.

components.name: App Shell
components.role: Wraps tab navigation, safe-area background, and top hero content.
components.interaction: Tabs switch contexts with 220ms sliding underline.

components.name: Search Hero
components.description: Primary entry point with location pills and contextual filters.
components.notes: Filter pills use pill radius with accent_info outline when active.

components.name: Suggestions Carousel
components.description: Horizontal scroll of quick destinations/services.

card_style.iconography: Rounded square background with monochrome icon

components.interaction: Scrolls with snap-to-card behavior and 12pt gap.

components.name: Promo Banner
components.description: Large message block featuring illustration and CTA.

components.name: Services Grid
components.description: Two-tier grid of tile buttons representing product categories.

components.name: Location List Item
components.description: List rows showing past or suggested destinations.

components.name: Filter Pills
components.description: Rounded selectors for pickup time, passenger count, etc.

components.name: Bottom Sheet
components.description: Draggable panel for ride selection and live status.
components.motion: Snap between states with spring easing.

components.name: Ride Option Card
components.description: Selectable card listing vehicle class, ETA, capacity, and price.

components.name: Primary CTA Button
components.description: Solid flare-red button with full-width option.

components.name: WhatsApp Support Button
components.description: Entry point to chat with support via WhatsApp.
components.notes: Only use the WhatsApp green for this action to maintain color meaning across the brand.

components.name: Secondary Ghost Button
components.description: Outlined button used for tertiary actions.

components.name: Tag / Chip
components.description: Prominent pill used for 'Promo' or status labels.

components.name: Driver Status Card
components.description: Live tracking summary containing driver photo, vehicle, rating, and contact actions.

components.name: Map Callout
components.description: Floating label that pins pickup and drop-off.

components.name: Text Field
components.description: Rounded input with icon-leading support.

components.name: Keyboard Accessory Bar
components.description: Optional quick actions bar above system keyboard.

components.name: Top App Bar - Map
components.description: Transparent app bar over the map with blur and contextual actions.

styling.background: scrim with low opacity over map

components.behavior: Appears over the map, remains pinned while map is visible, collapses to a minimal state when sheets are fully expanded.

components.name: Top App Bar - Surface
components.description: Solid surface app bar for list/detail screens.
components.behavior: Elevates when content scrolls under it; supports large-title variant paired with scrollable content.

components.name: Bottom Navigation Bar
components.description: Primary navigation between main areas (e.g., Rides, Eats, Activity).

components.name: Snackbar
components.description: Transient feedback anchored near the bottom, above navigation.
components.behavior: Auto-dismiss after a few seconds, only one visible at a time, appears above bottom sheet/navigation.

components.name: Toast
components.description: Lightweight status pill overlay used for non-critical confirmations.

components.name: Inline Banner
components.description: Persistent informational banner at the top of content.

components.name: Skeleton List Item
components.description: Placeholder row used while content is loading.

components.name: Skeleton Card
components.description: Placeholder card used while ride options or promos load.

components.name: Empty State View
components.description: Reusable layout for no-content states like no rides, no history, or offline.

components.name: Safety Sheet
components.description: Bottom sheet focused on safety and support actions for an active trip.

components.name: Trip Summary Card
components.description: Card representing a completed trip in history or receipts.

components.name: Checkbox
components.description: Binary selection control for forms and preferences.

components.name: Radio Group
components.description: Group of mutually exclusive choices.

components.name: Toggle Switch
components.description: On/off control for binary preferences like saving addresses.

components.name: Segmented Control
components.description: Horizontal control for switching between related views or filters (e.g., Past / Upcoming).

components.name: Select / Dropdown Field
components.description: Field that opens a menu of choices (e.g., payment method, country).

plan_ride_flow.guidelines: Each step uses a sticky progress context (pills at top). Provide back arrow in top-left on sub-pages.

map_plus_sheet.description: Map occupies upper 60% while sheet slides over bottom 40%.
map_plus_sheet.interaction: When sheet expands, map scales down subtly (0.96) to show depth.

driver_tracking.description: Live location updates every 1s with route line and ETA pill.
driver_tracking.tone: Reassuring, highlight driver rating and arrival countdown.

services_catalog.description: Modular grid of service tiles sorted by 'Go anywhere' then 'Get anything delivered'.
services_catalog.rules: Section title uses display_m, subtitles in body_small uppercase. Provide equal tile heights with icons centered.

responsive_layout.description: How layout adapts across compact, medium, and expanded widths.
rules: Compact: focus on single column lists and full-width bottom sheets.
Medium: increase grid columns and introduce side padding for readability.
Expanded: use split panes with navigation or lists on the left and detail on the right.

error_handling.description: Use inline banners for recoverable errors, snackbars for transient issues, and full empty states when no content is available.

safety_support.description: Safety and help access is always within one tap from active trip screens.
safety_support.rules: Never hide safety actions behind more than one layer of navigation. Prioritize clear, descriptive labels.

trip_history.description: Chronological list of completed trips grouped by date.
trip_history.rules: Group trips by day with clear headings; keep price and time aligned for quick scanning.

content_guidelines.numbers: Use 1 decimal for price if cents matter, otherwise round.
content_guidelines.capitalization: Sentence case everywhere except navigation labels.
content_guidelines.error_messages: Stay calm and actionable: briefly explain what happened and what the rider can do next.
content_guidelines.empty_states_copy: Acknowledge the situation, reassure the user, and always provide a clear next step.

accessibility.contrast: Maintain 4.5:1 for body text, 3:1 for large headings. Primary button text is pure white on black (21:1).
accessibility.motion_reduction: Provide fade alternatives for slide transitions when reduced motion is enabled.
accessibility.language: Announce driver states with concise status updates (e.g., 'Driver arriving in 3 minutes').
accessibility.gestures: Ensure any swipe or drag interaction has an equivalent button or action accessible via keyboard and screen reader.
